subject: Re: Hi Guys, I'm trying out the managewp clone and migration tool. It's...
preview: Re: Hi Guys, I'm trying out the managewp clone and migration tool. It's...

full_threads.body: Re: Hi Guys, I'm trying out the managewp clone and migration tool. It's...

You're welcome. If you have any other questions for us just let us know. https://js.intercomcdn.com/images/emojis/32x32/1f600.png

--

https://static.intercomassets.com/avatars/1433862/square_128/raam_2014-01-400x400-1503938569.jpg?1503938569 Raam from Kinsta

On Thu, Jun 14, 2018 at 11:08 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Ok great thanks for your help Raam. Speak soon

On Thu, Jun 14, 2018 at 11:07 AM, "Raam" <raam@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Yes, this is definitely something we have on our radar and I'll pass along this feedback to the team again. https://js.intercomcdn.com/images/emojis/32x32/1f600.png

On Thu, Jun 14, 2018 at 11:04 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Damn lol. Ok thanks - it's a feature that would be amazing... WPEngine have one that just works. I've mentioned it to you guys before, hopefully it's on a list of ideas for the future. We are actually migrating another 50 or so sites over from WPEngine as we get better performance and support with you guys. But, their migration plugin is that solid we sometimes migrate a new clients site from their server, to WPEngine via the plugin and then onto Kinsta via SSH. Crazy, but it's the only option when the original shared server is not powerful enough to generate a backup and can't get SFTP or server level access.

On Thu, Jun 14, 2018 at 11:01 AM, "Raam" <raam@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Yes, unfortunately in that case using SSH and/or SFTP would be the best option.

On Thu, Jun 14, 2018 at 11:00 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Yeah I find that sometimes the environments that clients are migrating from are less powerful shared type setups and the Duplicator plugin needs to run on those servers and often there is not enough resource to complete it. That's why I'm looking for a friendlier alternative. We have been migrating using SSH and/or SFTP, but it takes a little more time and fiddling compared to something like BlogVault.

It's a tricky one!

On Thu, Jun 14, 2018 at 10:57 AM, "Raam" <raam@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

I'm not sure—I don't believe so. If I'm not mistaken they use a similar remote-based migration. If you use something that involves running the database import on the Kinsta side, that should work fine. For example, the Duplicator plugin: https://kinsta.com/knowledgebase/migrate-wordpress-duplicator-plugin/

On Thu, Jun 14, 2018 at 10:55 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Ah - ok thanks.

Do you know if the BlogVault migration options work?

On Thu, Jun 14, 2018 at 10:55 AM, "Raam" <raam@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

In that case it will not work. The only way to remotely connect to the Kinsta database is to tunnel the connection over SSH. Please see https://kinsta.com/knowledgebase/db-access/

On Thu, Jun 14, 2018 at 10:53 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

remote I think

On Thu, Jun 14, 2018 at 10:53 AM, "Raam" <raam@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hello,

Those credentials look correct. How is the database connection being made? Is that being run on the Kinsta site itself, or is it trying to do a remote connection to the Kinsta database from the ManageWP servers?

On Thu, Jun 14, 2018 at 10:52 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Hi Guys, I'm trying out the managewp clone and migration tool. It's asking for the DB credentials and I'm entering what we have from the Kinsta dashboard, but it's not working... I thinking it may be the DB Host name? Any ideas?

https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/63244916/33c2d8feb9cd67b05824f659/Screen+Shot+2018-06-14+at+10.49.45+am.png
